Plant essential oils represent an alternative for pest control with low pollution and quick degradation in the environment, making them suitable for managing insects even in organic farming

In plants, terpenoids are products of secondary metabolism and are found in glandular hairs or secretory cavities of the plant cell wall in bark, flowers, fruits, leaves, roots and stems
25 . Essential oils and their constituents cause lethal and sublethal effects on insects, such as biocide activity, infertility, irritability, phagoinhibition and repellency
